truefalse.question_text: The basilar membrane in the cochlea vibrates uniformly along its entire length in response to all sound frequencies.
truefalse.correction: Different parts of the basilar membrane are tuned to different frequencies â€” high frequencies near the base, low frequencies near the apex.

truefalse.question_text: The inner hair cells of the cochlea are primarily responsible for converting mechanical sound vibrations into electrical signals that the brain can interpret.
